item.title: Face Recognition Under Aging
item.description:
Cite this paper as:

D. Deb, L. Best-Rowden, A. K. Jain, "Face Recognition Performance Under Aging", to appear in CVPR, Workshop on Biometrics, 2017.

item.title: Retro Future Space Battle for Love
item.description:
Questions at the beginning of the game that determine the player’s personality(Power-ups). They also determine their abilities in battle. Variations in strategy and the simplicity of combat will keep players coming back for more.

Retro Future Space Battle for Love stands out from both other dating sims and other simple competitive games by incorporating elements of both into a sweet, stylized, and action-packed story.

Conversation between players and their love interest takes place in a 2D, dating sim-esque screen with multiple dialogue options. Combat takes place in levels of varying shapes and sizes. The player must successfully jump, dodge, and maneuver the game world’s obstacles adeptly to achieve the goal of shooting the other player in the back.

item.title: Space Crusaders
item.description:
Space Crusaders is a two-player turn based strategy game marketed towards gamers attracted to the idea of a realtime futuristic chess arena.

Set in 2063, players control a team composed of 4 characters, each belonging to a separate class. The game also offers three different modes and three different maps.

item.title: Analysing mutation schemes for real-parameter genetic algorithms
item.description:
Cite this paper as:

K. Deb, D. Deb, “Analysing mutation schemes for real-parameter genetic algorithms,” International Journal of Artificial Intelligence and Soft Computing. 4(1), 59280 (2014).

item.title: Investigation of Mutation Schemes in Real-Parameter Genetic Algorithms
item.description:
Cite this paper as:

D. Deb, K. Deb. (2012) Investigation of Mutation Schemes in Real-Parameter Genetic Algorithms. Swarm, Evolutionary, and Memetic Computing. SEMCCO 2012. Lecture Notes in Computer Science, vol 7677. Springer, Berlin, Heidelberg

DEBAYAN DEB

PhD STUDENT / COMPUTER SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING

EDUCATION

2016 - 2021 (expected)

PhD, Computer Science and Engineering

Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)

Biometrics

Pattern Recognition and Image Processing Laboratory (PRIP), MSU

Advisor: Prof. Anil K. Jain

2012 - 2016

BS, Computer Science and Engineering

Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)

Minor: Mathematics

Minor: Game Design and Development

EXPERIENCE

2017

Intern

Rank One Computing (Denver, CO)

2015

Capstone

Techsmith (Okemos, MI)

Developed an Intelligent Real-World Text Recognition Application.

  • Using OCR technology, detect and recognize text in the real world and classify type of text as contacts, address, email, general text
  • Works on any device with Windows 10 - PC, Microsoft Surface, Windows Phone, Raspberry Pi
2014 - 2016

Project Researcher

Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)

Developed an algorithm to recognize street signs for vehicular vision.

  • Advisor: Professor Arun Ross
2014

Intern

Red Cedar Technology (East Lansing, MI)

QA testing, bug fixing, and backend scripting using Python.

2012

Project Researcher

Indian Institute of Technology (Kanpur, India)

Research on Genetic Algorithms.

  • Developed a Mutation operator and 5 different mutation schemes

TECHNICAL EXPERIENCE

Publications

Conference

D. Deb, L. Best-Rowden, A. K. Jain, "Face Recognition Performance Under Aging", to appear in CVPR, Workshop on Biometrics, 2017.

D. Deb and K. Deb., Investigation of Mutation Schemes in Real-Parameter Genetic Algorithms., Proceedings of Swarm, Evolutionary and Memetic Computing Conference (SEMCCO-2012), Heidelberg: Springer. 2012

Journal

K. Deb and D. Deb, Analyzing Mutation Schemes for Real- Parameter Genetic Algorithms., International Journal of Artificial Intelligence and Soft Computing (IJAISC), Inderscience Publishers. 2012

MagicMirror²
Developed various applications such as phone notification displays, email client, voice recognition, and internet statistics monitoring for MagicMirror². MagicMirror² is an open source modular smart mirror platform that has a monitor display behind a regular mirror.
Programming Languages

Proficient in

languages: C, C++, C#, Python, Java, JavaScript, Matlab, R, HTML, CSS

technologies: Android, iOS, MySQL, SQLite, LATEX, Bash Scripting, Git, Vim, jQuery, Bootstrap, NodeJS, Windows, Linux, OSX, Emacs, Flash, Photoshop

Experienced in

languages: PHP, Objective C, x86 assembly

technologies: Apache, Nginx, Visual Studio, .NET

RESEARCH HIGHLIGHTS

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

  • Presented poster on “Benchmarking Face Recognition Performance" in Engineering Symposium, Michigan State University

  • Won TechSmith Screencast Award for the Best Capstone Video in Design Day (December 2015).

  • Developed a cloud-based framework using Amazon Web Services (AWS) for training and recognizing objects using OpenComputerVision (OpenCV).

  • Participated at HackIllinois and developed an Android mobile application “RemoteLy" which converts the phone into a motion controller for games.

  • Designed and programmed a physics game with Professor Hendrik Schatz at the National Superconducting Cyclotron Laboratory, Michigan State University

  • Made a physics model explaining a concept for people with disabilities and donated it to the Resource Center for Persons with Disabilities (RCPD) at Michigan State University as a part of volunteering.

LANGUAGES

  • Proficient

    • English
    • Hindi
    • Bengali

  • Intermediate

    • French

INTERESTS

Soccer Intramural League at Michigan State University

Guitar Band at Michigan State University

debdebay@msu.edu • +1 (517) 930 0792 • 23 years old
address - East Lansing, Michigan, USA
